Lesson 4-7
You can use the Commutative and Associative Properties of Multiplication to find a pattern in products raised to a power.

m:math.alttext: Left parenthesis 4 times 2 right parenthesis superscript 3 baseline equals left parenthesis 4 times 2 right parenthesis times left parenthesis 4 times 2 right parenthesis times left parenthesis 4 times 2 right parenthesis
Equals 4 times 4 times 4 times 2 times 2 times 2

td.sent: Use the Commutative Property to arrange the factors.

m:math.alttext: Equals left parenthesis 4 times 4 times 4 right parenthesis times left parenthesis 2 times 2 times 2 right parenthesis

td.sent: Use the Associative Property to group the factors.

m:math.alttext: Equals 4 cubed times 2 cubed

p.sent: This result suggests a rule for simplifying products raised to a power.

level3.h3: Key Concepts Rule for Raising a Product to a Power

p.sent: To raise a product to a power, raise each factor to the power.

m:math.alttext: Left parenthesis 5 times 3 right parenthesis superscript 4 equals 5 superscript 4 baseline times 3 superscript 4
Left parenthesis a b right parenthesis superscript m equals a superscript m baseline times b superscript m
m

p.sent: To simplify an expression, you should eliminate as many parentheses as possible.
Rule for Raising a Power to a Power:

m:math.alttext: Left parenthesis a superscript m right parenthesis superscript n equals a superscript m times n baseline

level3.h3: 1 Example Simplifying a Power of a Product

p.sent: You can use repeated multiplication to write a power of a quotient.

p.sent: To raise a quotient to a power, raise both the numerator and denominator to the power.
